question: 少年
sourceMnemonic: Someone of <kanji>few</kanji> <kanji>year</kanji>s is someone who's young. But, back in the day the Japanese and Chinese tended to favor the boys, so this one means <vocabulary>boy</vocabulary>, usually a <vocabulary>young boy</vocabulary>. Sorry girls! Use your irritation at this kanji to remember it better.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
